metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12888 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: The VFIO PCI driver in the Linux kernel through 5.6.13 mishandles attempts to access disabled memory space. It was discovered that the VFIO PCI driver in the Linux kernel did not properly handle attempts to access disabled memory spaces. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
